Judul: MICROWAVE ASSISTED CALCINATION OF Fe2O3/C NANOCOMPOSITE AND ITS APPLICATION AS CATALYST IN AQUATHERMOLYSIS REACTION
Abstrak:
Synthesis of Fe2O3/C nanocomposite was successfully done using microwave assisted calcination method. FeCl3.6H2O, NaOH, and dextrose monohydrate (C6H12O6.H2O) were used as precursor solution. The precursor was heated using    
 

microwave and then calcined at 3500C for 30 minutes. The composition of carbon in the nanocomposite was varied by 25%, 33%, 50%, and 67%. The obtained samples were characterized using X-Ray Diffraction, Scanning Electron Microscope and Energy Dispersive X-Ray Spectroscopy. From X-Ray Diffraction, it was found that the Fe2O3 has maghemite crystal structure, while the carbon was amorphous. The crystal size of Fe2O3 was decrease as the    
 

increasing of carbon composition. Scanning Electron Microscopy results showed that the obtained particles were not uniform. The average obtained particles size were 199 nm and 73 nm for sample with carbon composition 33% and 50%, respectively. From Eergy Dispersive X-Ray Spectroscopy results, the dextrose monohydrate that used as carbon source was not entirely converted into carbon. The BET results of Fe2O3/C nanocomposite which calcined at 3500 C for 30 minutes, shows that the surface area of the sample was around 255.65 m2/g. Hematite crystal structure starts to form at 4000 C. From the calcination  
 

temperature variation experiment, the crystal size of the particle increases as the increasing of the calcination temperature. The catalytic properties of the  
 

prepared samples were tested in aquathermolysis reaction. At temperature of 2000 C for 6 hours in autoclave, Fe2O3/C with 50% of carbon gave the highest  
 

catalytic performance of reducing the viscosity of heavy oil up to 90%.
